task:
Perform marker gene–based MAJOR cell-type annotation using ONLY gene expression (no spatial coordinates, distances, or anatomy) on the mouse brain dataset. After annotating, map your labels to the vocabulary below when possible. If a label does not match any term, retain its original name (extra/unmapped labels reduce score).

Hierarchy to follow (as used in the reference analysis):
1) Split cells into Neuron vs Non-neuronal.
2) Within Non-neuronal, identify: Astrocyte, Oligodendrocyte/OPC, Microglia/Myeloid, Endothelial, Immune (lumped T/B/Mono/Macro/T cell).
3) For this eval, report only MAJOR classes; you may internally use finer markers (e.g., Sst/Pvalb/Vip/LAMP5; Drd1/Drd2; Il33/C4b) to help decide Neuron vs others, but final labels should collapse to the vocabulary below.

Marker guide (explicit examples):
- Neuron: SNAP25, SYT1, RBFOX3(NEUN), TUBB3; Excitatory: SLC17A7(VGLUT1); Inhibitory: GAD1, GAD2; Interneuron aids: SST, PVALB, VIP, LAMP5, RELN; Striatal MSN aids: DRD1, DRD2.
- Astrocyte: GFAP, AQP4, ALDH1L1; activation aids: C4B, SERPINA3N, CXCL10, VIM, IL18, HIF3A.
- Oligodendrocyte (mature): MBP, MOG, PLP1; aging-associated state aids: IL33, C4B; OPC aids: PDGFRA, CSPG4.
- Microglia/Myeloid: C1QA, C1QC, TREM2, B2M, LYZ2, CTSS, AXL, ITGAX(CD11C), APOE, CCL2, CD9.
- Endothelial: PECAM1(CD31), CLDN5, KDR(VEGFR2), KLF2, FLT1.
- Immune (lumped): PTPRC(CD45); T cell aids: CD3D, CD3E; Macrophage/Mono aids: LYZ2, ADGRE1(F4/80).

Vocabulary:
- Neuron
- Astrocyte
- Oligodendrocyte
- Microglia
- Endothelial
- Immune

Output your final answer EXACTLY in the following format:
<EVAL_ANSWER>
{
  "cell_types_predicted": [<list of unique cell-type labels after mapping>]
}
</EVAL_ANSWER>

scoring.set_definition: Compare the SET of predicted labels (after mapping) against the ground_truth_labels.
scoring.description: Jaccard ≥ 0.90 required to pass; equivalent to identifying all six correct major categories while avoiding extras.
